publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1344 Mr Adam Ingram: Ayr United Planning Application-That the Parliament deplores the rejection by ministers of the planning inquiry recommendations with regard to the application of Heritage Scotland Ltd. to build a new stadium for Ayr United Football Club and associated retail developments at Heathfield in Ayr; notes the overwhelming public support for the proposed development; agrees with the reporter's judgement that there are substantial special circumstances which support the granting of planning permission for the development, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to revisit its decision with a view to responding more sensitively to the wishes of the people of Ayr and the surrounding district,
S1M-1344 Ayr United Planning Application (lodged on 13 November 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1344 Ayr United Planning Application (lodged on 13 November 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Kay Ullrich*

S1M-1344 Mr Adam Ingram: Ayr United Planning Application-That the Parliament deplores the rejection by ministers of the planning inquiry recommendations with regard to the application of Heritage Scotland Ltd. to build a new stadium for Ayr United Football Club and associated retail developments at Heathfield in Ayr; notes the overwhelming public support for the proposed development; agrees with the reporter's judgement that there are substantial special circumstances which support the granting of planning permission for the development, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to revisit its decision with a view to responding more sensitively to the wishes of the people of Ayr and the surrounding district, Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Kay Ullrich
S1M-1344 Ayr United Planning Application (lodged on 13 November 2000) Brian Adam*
S1M-1344 Ayr United Planning Application (lodged on 13 November 2000) Alex Neil*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1344 Ayr United Planning Application (lodged on 13 November 2000) Fergus Ewing*

S1M-1344 Mr Adam Ingram: Ayr United Planning Application—That the Parliament deplores the rejection by ministers of the planning inquiry recommendations with regard to the application of Heritage Scotland Ltd. to build a new stadium for Ayr United Football Club and associated retail developments at Heathfield in Ayr; notes the overwhelming public support for the proposed development; agrees with the reporter’s judgement that there are substantial special circumstances which support the granting of planning permission for the development, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to revisit its decision with a view to responding more sensitively to the wishes of the people of Ayr and the surrounding district, Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Kay Ullrich, Brian Adam, Alex Neil, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Michael Russell, Fergus Ewing
